item.title: 意大利国际信托银行（Intesa）在比利时和卢森堡拓展数字投资业务
item.description: 意大利最大的银行意大利联合圣保罗银行（Intesa Sanpaolo）周五表示，其 Fideuram 私人银行部门将与贝莱德（BlackRock）合作，在比利时和卢森堡推出数字投资产品。【原文：Italy's biggest bank Intesa Sanpaolo said on Friday its Fideuram private banking arm was launching a digital investment offer partnering with BlackRock in Belgium and Luxembourg.】

item.title: 白宫顾问称美国政府关门的影响远比预期严重
item.description: 白宫经济顾问凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）周五表示，美国政府关门对经济的影响远比预期严重，但一旦关门结束，美国经济很可能迅速反弹。【原文：The economic impact of the U.S. government shutdown is far worse than expected, but the U.S. economy is likely to rebound quickly once it ends, White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett said on Friday.】

item.title: PNC 扩大分行扩张计划，到 2030 年达到 300 多家分行
item.description: 美国贷款公司 PNC 周五表示，它将在 2030 年前新开设 300 多家分行，比之前的计划增加约 100 家分行，以扩大其个人银行业务的覆盖范围。【原文：U.S. lender PNC said on Friday it will be opening more than 300 new branches by 2030, adding about 100 locations to its earlier plan as it looks to expand its in-person banking footprint.】

item.title: 中国恢复美国公司的大豆许可证，终止原木禁令
item.description: 中国海关总署周五表示，中国将从11月10日起恢复三家美国公司的大豆进口许可证，并取消暂停美国原木进口的禁令，这是两国贸易紧张局势缓和的又一迹象。【原文：China will restore soybean import licences for three U.S. firms and lift its suspension on U.S. log imports starting November 10, its customs authority said on Friday in another sign of easing trade tensions between the two nations.】

item.title: 华尔街对特斯拉投资者批准马斯克 1 万亿美元薪酬计划的反应
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）赢得了股东对史上最大企业薪酬方案的批准。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk has won shareholder approval for the largest corporate pay package in history.】

item.title: 美国航空公司警告说，随着联邦航空局削减航班数量的增加，问题会越来越多
item.description: 美国航空公司首席执行官罗伯特-伊森（Robert Isom）周五表示，预计政府下令削减航班的初期措施不会对客户造成重大影响，但他警告说，进一步削减航班将是 "有问题的"。【原文：American Airlines CEO Robert Isom does not expect significant disruption for customers from initial government-ordered flight reductions, he said on Friday, warning that increased cuts will be "problematic".】

item.title: 加拿大 10 月份就业市场意外扩大，失业率下降
item.description: 周五的数据显示，加拿大 10 月份就业市场稳健增长，扭转了过去的颓势并超出预期，失业率也有所下降。【原文：Canada's job market made a solid gain in October, reversing past declines and beating expectations, and its unemployment rate fell, data showed on Friday.】

item.title: 纽蒙特在纽克雷斯特交易后的重组中裁员 16% - 备忘录
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份给员工的内部备忘录，纽蒙特公司在收购澳大利亚矿商纽克雷斯特公司（Newcrest）后已裁员约 16%，作为重组的一部分。【原文：Newmont has cut about 16% of its workforce as part of a restructuring following the acquisition of Australian miner Newcrest, according to an internal memo to staff seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 需求疲软拖累机械制造商 CNH 下调全年利润预期
item.description: 农用和建筑机械制造商 CNH Industrial 周五下调了全年利润预期，因为该公司有意缩减拖拉机和联合收割机的产量，以避免在需求低迷的情况下出现供应过剩。【原文：Farm and construction machinery maker CNH Industrial lowered its full-year profit forecast on Friday, as it intentionally scaled back production of tractors and combines to avoid a supply glut amid sluggish demand.】

item.title: 分析师称，《GTA VI》推迟到 2026 年 11 月上市让 Take-Two 有可能推出更大规模的游戏
item.description: 侠盗猎车手 6》的一再推迟并没有让分析师们感到不安，他们认为新的发布时间窗口将使 Take-Two Interactive 公司在明年推出这款电子游戏业备受期待的游戏时引起更大的轰动。【原文：Repeated delays of "Grand Theft Auto VI" have failed to perturb analysts, who believe the new release window will allow Take-Two Interactive to make a bigger splash when it launches the videogame industry's highly anticipated title next year.】

item.title: 民主党可能重新崛起让投资者警惕政策转变
item.description: 民主党本周的胜利引起了投资者的关注，这预示着该党在去年大选中惨败后可能卷土重来。【原文：Democratic victories this week have caught investors' attention, signaling a potential comeback after the party's bruising defeat during last year's election.】

item.title: 美联储副主席杰斐逊：随着政策利率接近中性，缓慢削减是合理的
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）周五表示，随着货币政策向中性立场靠拢，美联储应 "缓慢 "批准进一步降息。【原文：The Fed should "proceed slowly" in approving further interest rate cuts as monetary policy moves closer to a neutral stance, Fed Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国关税增加成本，宜家利润下降 26%，降至 20 亿美元
item.description: 为全球宜家商场供应家具的瑞典 Inter IKEA 公司周五表示，由于美国关税的影响导致成本上升，该公司的年度营业利润下降了 26%。【原文：Sweden's Inter IKEA, which supplies furniture to IKEA stores around the world, said on Friday its annual operating profit dropped 26% as the impacts of U.S. tariffs drove up costs.】

item.title: 杰克-多西领导的 Block 公司股价下跌，原因是人们对 Square 盈利能力的担忧
item.description: 金融科技公司 Block 的股价在周五的盘前交易中下跌了 14.5%，原因是投资者对其支付部门 Square 的利润增长落后于交易量增长表示不满。【原文：Shares of fintech Block fell 14.5% in premarket trading on Friday, as investors balked at profit growth lagging volume increase at its payments unit, Square.】

item.title: 资金流入增加，KKR 季度利润超出预期
item.description: 周五，KKR 公布第三季度利润增长超过华尔街预期，主要得益于强劲的筹资，尤其是保险部门和信贷部门。【原文：KKR reported a rise in third-quarter profit that beat Wall Street's expectations on Friday, boosted by strong fundraising, particularly in its insurance unit and credit.】

item.title: 法国要求调查后，欧盟委员会与谢因举行会谈
item.description: 欧盟委员会发言人表示，欧盟委员会和申银万国的代表将于周五会面，此前法国政府要求对中国电子商务集团进行调查，因为该集团涉嫌在其市场上销售类似儿童的性玩偶和违禁武器。【原文：Representatives of the European Commission and Shein will meet on Friday, a spokesperson of the Commission said, after the French government called for an investigation into the Chinese e-commerce group due to the alleged sale of child-like sex dolls and banned weapons on its marketplace.】

item.title: 华尔街期货在摇摆不定的一周结束时艰难前行
item.description: 周五，在华尔街因对经济的担忧和科技行业的高估值而经历了摇摆不定的一周之后，美国股指期货在艰难地挣扎着。【原文：U.S. stock futures struggled for traction on Friday, after a wobbly week for Wall Street amid concerns about the economy and sky-high valuations in the technology sector.】

item.title: Expedia股价因商务客户预订量大增而跳涨
item.description: 周五，Expedia 股价在盘前交易中上涨了 15.8%，此前该在线旅行社预计 2025 年收入和利润率将有所增长，这主要得益于其商业客户的强劲预订量。【原文：Shares of Expedia rose 15.8% in premarket trading on Friday after the online travel agent forecast higher 2025 revenue and margin growth, banking on strong bookings from its business clients.】

item.title: Z 世代的购物者对香水爱不释手。科蒂和雅诗受益匪浅
item.description: 香水已成为 Z 世代购物者的主打产品，也是全球增长最快的买家类别，而美容界的重量级人物也都在追赶这一潮流。【原文：Fragrances have become a staple for Gen Z shoppers, the fastest-growing buyer category globally, and beauty heavyweights are here for the trend.】

item.title: 降价帮助更多美国人开始服用减肥药，但可能无法坚持下去
item.description: 美国肥胖症专家说，特朗普政府同意降低韦格威和Zepbound等流行减肥药的价格，这将使数百万美国人有机会尝试这些药物，但费用可能仍然太高，无法长期留住患者。【原文：A Trump administration deal to cut prices for popular weight-loss drugs like Wegovy and Zepbound will allow millions more Americans to give them a try, but the cost may still be too high to keep patients long term, U.S. obesity specialists said.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 投资者关注美国经济迹象，市场回调，科技股岌岌可危
item.description: 在令人担忧的劳动力市场报告和技术引发的动荡导致股市从历史高位回落之后，投资者将在下周寻找有关美国经济健康状况的线索。【原文：Investors will seek clues about the health of the U.S. economy in the coming week following worrisome labor market reports and technology-led turbulence that has knocked the stock market off record highs.】

item.title: 美联储在追寻经济数据时转向屡试不爽的新数据
item.description: 在美国联邦储备委员会最后一次会议召开前两周，由于联邦政府的数据水龙头已经关闭，亚特兰大联储的工作人员通过分析过去对企业高管的调查与联邦报告中的就业、支出、产出和其他数据的一致性，来支持他们对经济的看法。【原文：Two weeks before the U.S. Federal Reserve's last meeting, with the federal government's data spigot closed, Atlanta Fed staff backstopped their view of the economy by analyzing how past surveys of business executives had aligned with employment, spending, output and other data captured in federal reports.】

item.title: 面对全球威胁，美国将精简五角大楼的武器采购程序
item.description: 美国国防部长皮特-黑格塞斯（Pete Hegseth）预计将于周五公布对五角大楼采购武器方式的全面改革，从而使军方能够在全球威胁日益增长的情况下更迅速地获取技术。【原文：U.S. Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth is expected to unveil sweeping changes to how the Pentagon purchases weapons on Friday, allowing the military to more rapidly acquire technology amid growing global threats.】

item.title: 美国就业报告将不再公布，因为政府停摆仍在继续
item.description: 由于政府继续关门，美国劳工部周五将破天荒地连续第二个月不公布其密切关注的就业报告。【原文：The U.S. Labor Department on Friday will not publish its closely watched employment report for an unprecedented second straight month as the government remains shut, and fears are mounting October's report might not be released when full operations resume.】

item.title: 印度外卖平台 Swiggy 批准通过 QIP 募集高达 1,000 亿卢比资金
item.description: 印度食品和杂货配送公司 Swiggy 周五表示，其董事会批准了通过合格机构配售（QIP）筹集最多 1,000 亿卢比（11.4 亿美元）资金的计划，以充实资本，促进增长。【原文：Indian food and grocery delivery firm Swiggy on Friday said its board approved plans to raise up to 100 billion rupees($1.14 billion) via qualified institutional placement (QIP) as it seeks to shore up capital for growth.】

item.title: 法国政府为邮政与中国特木公司的协议辩护
item.description: 法国商务部长周五为法国国有邮政服务公司与中国电子商务网站特木网最近达成的一项协议进行了辩护。【原文：France's commerce minister on Friday defended a recent deal between the state-owned postal service and Chinese ecommerce site Temu, agreed just weeks before the Paris prosecutor launched an investigation into several online marketplaces.】

item.title: 随着扭亏为盈战略取得进展，Peloton 股价大涨
item.description: Peloton Interactive 周五在盘前交易中股价大涨超过 7%，此前这家健身公司的季度营收超过预期，这主要得益于其改良产品阵容的早期吸引力以及硬件和订阅价格的上涨，增强了投资者对其扭亏为盈战略的信心。【原文：Peloton Interactive shares jumped more than 7% in premarket trading on Friday after the fitness company beat quarterly revenue estimates, buoyed by early traction from its revamped product lineup and price hikes across hardware and subscriptions, reinforcing investor confidence in its turnaround strategy.】

item.title: DeepSeek 研究员对人工智能的影响持悲观态度，这是这家初创公司成功后首次公开露面
item.description: 中国人工智能（AI）开发商深鉴科技（DeepSeek）在轰动全球近一年后首次公开露面，现场一位高级研究员在政府组织的互联网会议上表示，他对人工智能未来对人类的影响持悲观态度。【原文：Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) developer DeepSeek made its first public appearance in almost a year after it became a global sensation, fielding a senior researcher who told a government-organised internet conference that he was pessimistic about AI's future impact on humanity.】

item.title: 联合国粮农组织称 10 月份世界粮食价格连续第二个月下降
item.description: 联合国粮食及农业组织周五表示，10月份世界粮食商品价格连续第二个月下跌，主要原因是全球供应充足。【原文：World food commodity prices fell for a second consecutive month in October, driven largely by ample global supplies, the United Nations' Food and Agriculture Organization said on Friday.】

item.title: 奥莫维奥公司首席执行官表示，Nexperia 芯片供应紧张已获出口豁免
item.description: 德国奥莫维奥公司（Aumovio）的首席执行官周五表示，该公司是在Nexperia事件中面临供应链压力的汽车供应商之一，已获得中国的豁免，可以恢复出口该公司的芯片。【原文：Germany's Aumovio , one of the automotive suppliers facing pressure on its supply chains in the spat over Nexperia, has received an exemption from China to resume exports of the company's chips, its chief executive said on Friday.】
